title: South Korean Antarctic institute assigns names to features
summary: The South Korean National Geographic Information Institute announced 16 Korean names for new geographic features around Jang Bogo Station in Antarctica as part of international contributions to the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica.

title: Magnitude 6.4 earthquake hits Japan’s Tottori and Shimane
summary: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Tottori and Shimane Prefectures in Japan, injuring several people and prompting local emergency responses.

title: Glaciologists reach South Pole during Antarctica expedition
summary: Explorers Heidi Sevestre and Matthieu Tordeur reached the South Pole on the 61st day of their ice mapping snowkiting expedition as part of scientific research in Antarctica.

title: World Indoor Bowls Championship held in England
summary: The 2026 World Indoor Bowls Championship took place in Great Yarmouth with international competitors; England’s Robert Paxton won the open singles title.

title: World Economic Forum holds 56th Annual Meeting in Davos
summary: Global leaders gathered in Davos for the 56th World Economic Forum, focusing on cooperation, innovation, and geopolitical risks affecting the global economy.

title: Israeli airstrikes and conflict incidents in Middle East
summary: Israeli forces conducted airstrikes in Lebanon and Gaza, resulting in casualties including journalists and civilians as part of ongoing regional conflict dynamics.

title: New Zealand storms prompt evacuations
summary: Severe storms in New Zealand led to flooding and landslides, forcing evacuations in low-lying areas of the North Island.

title: EU designates Iran’s Revolutionary Guard as terrorist organization
summary: The European Union officially designated Iran’s IRGC as a terrorist organization, imposing sanctions on officials amid concerns over human rights violations.

title: UK and China agree to lift travel restrictions on lawmakers
summary: China announced it will lift previously imposed travel restrictions on British lawmakers during UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s visit aimed at strengthening bilateral relations.

title: WWE Royal Rumble 2026 held in Riyadh
summary: The 39th annual WWE Royal Rumble took place in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, marking the first time the event was hosted outside North America with wrestlers competing for a title match spot at WrestleMania.
